testprocedure.test-case-summary: This test procedure is called by a test case and is used to verify the SUTs support of the dlDetectorInventoryRequest dialog as an EC using variables provided by the calling test case. This procedure supports verification of requirements related to user need 2.3.6.1.5 [Need for Detector Data Correlation] and is used for both valid and invalid test cases.

testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the Application Layer Standard that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: ApplicationLayerStandard: ${ApplicationLayerStandard}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Authentication is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.6.1.1.1.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N22R365_Authentication_Supported = ${TMDD_N22R365_Authentication_Supported}

Step 3 CONFIGURE: Determine whether External Center Organization is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.6.1.1.1.2.2). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N22R366_External_Center_Organization_Supported = ${TMDD_N22R366_External_Center_Organization_Supported}

Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Content of Device Information Request Filter is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.6.1.1.1.3). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N22R402_Inventory_Date_and_Time_Change_Information_Supported = ${TMDD_N22R402_Inventory_Date_and_Time_Change_Information_Supported}
Step 57 CONFIGURE: Define the response message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: ResponseMessage: ${ResponseMessage}
Step 58 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the Authentication parameters need to be verified within this test. RECORD this information as: AuthenticationCheck: ${AuthenticationCheck}
Step 59 CONFIGURE: Identify the Username expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: Username: ${Username}
Step 60 CONFIGURE: Identify the Password expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: Password: ${Password}
Step 61 CONFIGURE: Identify the Organization Identifier expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: OrganizationID: ${OrganizationID}
Step 62 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SUT will be allowed access to the information requested in this test. RECORD this information as: AllowAccess: ${AllowAccess}
Step 63 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorResponseExpected: ${ErrorResponseExpected}
Step 64 CONFIGURE: IF ErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorTypeExpected: ${ErrorTypeExpected}
Step 65 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SUT is expected to have valid data available for a response message in this test. RECORD this information as: DataValid: ${DataValid}

Step 66 REQUEST-RESPONSE-OC-RECEIVE with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlDetectorInventoryRequest AUTHENTICATIONCHECK = AuthenticationCheck USERNAME = Username PASSWORD = Password ORGANIZATIONID = OrganizationID ALLOWACCESS = AllowAccess ERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = ErrorResponseExpected ERRORTYPEEXPECTED = ErrorTypeExpected DATAVALID = DataValid
Step 67 IF ErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 67.1 IF TMDD_N22R365_Authentication_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 67.1.1 VERIFY that element authentication exists within deviceInformationRequestMsg
Step 67.2 IF TMDD_N22R366_External_Center_Organization_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 67.2.1 VERIFY that element organization-requesting exists within deviceInformationRequestMsg
Step 67.3 IF TMDD_N22R367_Content_of_Device_Information_Request_Filter_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 67.3.1 VERIFY that element device-filter exists within deviceInformationRequestMsg
Step 67.4 IF TMDD_N22R368_Device_Identifier_Filter_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 67.4.1 VERIFY that element device-id-list exists within each instance of deviceInformationRequestMsg.device-filter
Step 67.5 IF TMDD_N22R369_Roadway_Network_Identifier_Filter_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 67.5.1 VERIFY that element network-id-list exists within each instance of deviceInformationRequestMsg.device-filter
Step 67.6 IF TMDD_N22R370_Link_Identifier_Filter_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 67.6.1 VERIFY that element link-id-list exists within each instance of deviceInformationRequestMsg.device-filter
Step 67.7 IF TMDD_N22R371_Route_Designator_Filter_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 67.7.1 VERIFY that element link-designator-list exists within each instance of deviceInformationRequestMsg.device-filter
Step 67.8 IF TMDD_N22R372_Linear_Reference_Filter_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 67.8.1 VERIFY that element linear-reference exists within each instance of deviceInformationRequestMsg.device-filter
Step 67.9 IF TMDD_N22R377_Authentication_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 67.10 IF TMDD_N22R378_Device_Description_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.

USER-VERIFY-MESSAGE.functionId: The User Verifies the message content

testStep.functionId: Step 67.57 CONFIGURE: Set OptionalContentVerified to True

Step 67.58 POSTCONDITION: REQUEST-RESPONSE-OC-REPLY with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlDetectorInventoryRequest OPTIONALCONTENTVERIFIED = OptionalContentVerified RESPONSEMESSAGE = ResponseMessage
